before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"1tki8","text":"Always wear proper Personal Protective Equipment and work in a fume hood when working with hexanes, hydrochloric acid, MTBE, diazomethane, polychlorinated biphenyl (PCBs) and their derivatives, and strong acids and bases. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vpvr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f5g8","text":"Note that this protocol involves work with experimental animals and requires prior approval by the users' Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) or equivalent ethics committee.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ahle","text":"This protocol describes the extraction of 3,3'-dichlorobiphenyl (PCB11) and its monohydoxylated metabolites from mouse blood/serum using liquid-liquid extraction followed by solid-phase extraction clean-up. The levels of PCB11 and OH-PCB11s in the blood/serum samples are subsequently measured by gas chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"fn98f","text":"The responsible Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) approved the animal protocol used to generate tissue samples. All animals were utilized in accordance with all Public Health Service (PHS) policies and the Guide for the Care and Use of Laboratory Animals, National Institutes of Health (NIH) Publication No. 85-23, revised 2010.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

standards","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1v31","text":"3,5-Dichlorobiphenyl (PCB14), 3,3'-dichlorinated biphenyl (PCB11), 3,3'-dichlorobiphenyl-2-ol (2-OH-PCB11), 3,3'-dichlorobiphenyl-4-ol (4-OH-PCB11), 3,3'-dichlorobiphenyl-5-ol (5-OH-PCB11),3,3'-dichlorobiphenyl-6-ol (6-OH-PCB11) were synthesized and authenticated as described previously (Li, 2018; Dhakal, 2012, Dhakal, 2020, and Zhu, 2013). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11t20","text":"2,4,6-Trichlorobiphenyl (PCB30), 3,4,4',5,5',6'-octachlorobiphenyl (PCB204), and 2',3,3',4',5,5'-hexachlorobiphenyl-4-ol (4'-OH-PCB159) were purchased from AccuStandard Inc. (New Haven, CT, USA). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"et328","text":"Deuterated 2,3,5,6-tetrachlorobiphenyl (d-PCB65) was provided by CND Isotopes Inc., Quebec, Canada. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6kct","text":"\nAnalytical standard solutions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8a2af","text":"Surrogate standard (SS)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anidh","text":"          d-PCB65 (SS_PCB, 100 ng/mL in isooctane)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"386rm","text":"          PCB14 (SS_PCB, 100 ng/mL in centrifuge 5810, (Eppendorf, 022625004)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20h06","text":"Vortex mixer, (Fisher, 1156Y21)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sd40","text":"SPE Vacuum Manifold, 12 ports, (Sigma-Aldrich, 57-160-U \u0026 57-162-U)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42gch","text":"","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ao82","text":"Reagents and solvents","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acfno","text":"1:1 Hexane: methyl tert-butyl ether (MTBE) (v/v) in amber bottle with cap. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsuft","text":"1% KCl (w/w) in 500 mL volumetric flask: Add 5 g KCl in 500 mL of Milli-q water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0hej","text":"6 M HCl in 100 mL volumetric flask: Add 50 mL of HCl (12M) with 50 mL of Milli-q water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gemv","text":"Acidified silica gel. The silica gel in a beaker was combusted at 450 °C for overnight. After cooling down, the sigical gel was transfer to a screw-capped glass bottle. The mixture of combusted silica gel and sulfuric acid by weight ratio of 5 : 1 (For example, 40 g of silica gel was mixed with 8 g of sulfuric acid) was shaked vigorously until no lumps were observed. The acidified silica gel was kept in another screw-capped glass bottle and read for the SPE cartridge. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"364kc","text":"1 M KOH in 95% EtOH in 50 mL beaker: Weigh and add 2.8 g of KOH and 2.5 g of Milli-q water. Mix to dissolve, then add 47.5 mL EtOH. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ndd6","text":"Place whole blood (0.3-0.5 g) or serum (~ 0.2 g) in tube-A. Record weight on the working sheet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23v97","text":"Spike all tube-A samples (MB, TB, tissue, OPR, and Reference standard) with SS_PCB (10 ng d-PCB65 and 10 ng PCB14). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ear3q","text":" d-PCB65, 100 µL x 100 ng/mL = 10 ng each","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcpdh","text":" PCB14, 100 µL x 100 ng/mL = 10 ng each","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"etd88","text":"Add 1 mL of 6 M HCl to tube-A, vortex for 10 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bke64","text":"Get samples, ice box, and serological pipettes ready in a fume hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"13fpm","text":"Add 3 mL of hexane with a repeat pipettor and vortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fd2rl","text":"Prepare the SPE cartridges.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"df5j2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ecvbt","text":"Note: The SPE cartridge can also be prepared using the dry reagent loading method: Glass wool is placed on the bottom of the SPE cartridges, and 0.2 g of silica gel and 2 g of acidified silica gel are added. Then, 3 mL of hexane:DCM (1:1) mixture is passed through the cartridge to rinse the filled cartridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":309}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ea7th","text":"\nNote: DCM is toxic, need to work in fume hood with good ventilation condition. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":80},{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2etvv","text":"Spike 100 µL of IS (PCB30+PCB204, 100 µL x 100 ng/mL = 10 ng each) to each tube-E and Reference standard using a single channel pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":75,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":86,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e6fsq","text":"Spike all tube-A samples (MB, TB, tissue, OPR, and reference) with SS_OH-PCB (10 ng 4’-OH-PCB159). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77vlf","text":" 4’-OH-PCB159, 100 µL x 100 ng/mL = 10 ng each","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ep02","text":"Spike the following analytes only to tube-A OPR samples and the Reference standard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":64,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ermlo","text":"100 µL of PCB11 standard (100 µL x 100 ng/mL = 10 ng)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnvml","text":"100 µL of OH-PCB11 standard mixture (100 µL x 100 ng/mL = 10 ng each)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":43,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ej61m","text":"Cap tube-A and the Reference standard.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":19,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"380vu","text":"Transfer the organic phase (top layer) from tube-A to tube-B with a short glass pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45b09","text":"Transfer the organic layer (top layer) form tube-B to tube-C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aj05m","text":"Add ~0.5 mL of diazomethane to each sample and 1 mL of diazomethane to the Reference standard using a 10 mL serological pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":75,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9lm33","text":"Cap the tubes and keep them in a solvent-proof refrigerator (NOT freezer) at 4-8 °C for at least 3 h or overnight (approximately 16 h).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":61,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":61,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aeimu","text":"Evaporate the Reference standard to near dryness (~ 50 μ L) and put it aside for the IS spiking step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":14,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"btdqj","text":"Evaporate the excess of ether and diazomethane in a fume hood under a gentle nitrogen flow (no yellow color, ~200 µL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avejs","text":"Add 2 mL of KOH-95% EtOH solution with a repeat pipettor and vortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ols4","text":"Heat for 1 hour in 50 °C water bath, vortexing the samples approximately every 15 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2uis9","text":"Add 7 mL of Mili-Q water with a repeat pipettor, invert, and centrifuge. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"24eh5","text":"Rinse tube-E with hexane (~150 µL) and combine with to the GC vial insert to give a final volume of ~300 µL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5rgm7","text":"With long glass pipettes, slowly load the extracts from tube-D into the SPE cartridges and pass them through the cartridges for collection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":56,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56vnn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ma4j","text":"Notes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffik2","text":"Adjust the vacuum of the manifold accordingly, and let the eluent drip drop by drop. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":85}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d784t","text":"Close off the vacuum once the gel is dry to avoid evaporating the sample liquid.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":80}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j44l","text":"Always keep the solvent level above silica gel.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1oe8o","text":"Replace the waste tubes at the bottom with freshly labeled, combusted tube-E. Align tube-D order in the tube rack with the order of tube-E.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":84,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":132,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4fj9o","text":"Quality control samples should include:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbqcu","text":"Method blank (MB): x2 or x3 to make sample number even","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"114b9","text":"Tissue blank (TB): blood or serum from control animals","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5h6nk","text":"Tissue samples: blood or serum from exposed animals","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7s264","text":"Ongoing Precision and Recovery (OPR): tissue blank spiked with surrogate standard (SS), internal standard (IS), and analytes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"quv0","text":"Reference standards: includes SS, IS, and analytes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68mch","text":"Instrument blank or solvent: hexane only","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qppu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"902er","text":"Note: For the spike test, use only blank blood/serum. For actual tests, use blank blood/serum and exposed samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":115},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g58","text":"Combust silica gel, glass wool, all glassware (cartridges, short and long pipettes, tubes, beaker/volumetric flask, funnel), scalpel, forceps, and spatula.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"di6fg","text":"Print the working sheet (see attachment for an example).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mca7","text":"Label tubes as A1, A2 etc, and Reference standard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":31,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bp5uv","text":"Note: For the entire method, all centrifugation steps are for 5 mins at 3000 rpm. Tubes are inverted on the tube rotator for 5 mins at 40 RPM. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":143},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dvf7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ej1t","text":"Note: For the evaporation or “blow down” step with nitrogen, a warm water bath (35 °C) can be used if needed. ","type":"header-four","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":110},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3l7g5","text":"Transfer the organic phase (top layer) from tube-A to tube-B with a short pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"akk0s","text":"Evaporate the solvent under a gentle stream of nitrogen to ~0.5 mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2piuj","text":" Rinse tube-D twice (2 x 0.5 mL) with hexane:DCM (1:1) and pass through the cartridge each time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7emjg","text":"Repeatedly add the hexane:DCM (1:1) mixture (total volume ~ 9 mL) until the eluent in tube-E reaches 10 mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":86,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6mg2o","text":"Add 3 mL of 1% KCl solution to tube A containing blank samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"gdds","text":"Add 5 mL of 2-propanol to tube-A, vortex for 10 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fg171","text":"Add 5 mL of hexane-MTBE mixture 1:1 (v/v) to tube-A.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2icc","text":"Cap the tube-A with caps with a PTFE septum.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"p2mn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e7jih","text":"Add 3 mL of 1% KCl solution to tube-B.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":31,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3sus","text":"Invert tube-B for 5 min and centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67ks","text":"Transfer the organic layer (top layer) form tube-B to tube-C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49d2","text":"Re-extract tube-B with 3 mL of hexane, vortex, and centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ffi69","text":"Evaporate solvent in tube-C under a gentle stream of nitrogen to ~100 µL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":21,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t2b6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23gkd","text":"Note: Do not evaporate to dryness.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":34},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2vo43","text":"Prepare the solvent blank by filling a GC vial with hexane. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5th1v","text":"\nNote: Use the same hexane used for the extractions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7a49v","text":"Recap the samples after the GC-MS/MS or GC-ECD analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3v9k","text":"Label all sample tubes (Tube-A, Tube-B, Tube-C, Tube-D, and Tube-E).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":24,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":40,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":48,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":60,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ffll5","text":"Put the Reference standard aside for the derivatization step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b636h","text":"Re-extract tube-A with 3 mL of hexane-MTBE (1:1, v/v), vortex for 10 s, and centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7qdfg","text":"Invert tube-A on the tube rotator and centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1nue","text":"Remove the analytical standards for the ORP and the SS from the freezer and allow to warm to room temperature (~ 30 min).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"71m4o","text":"Note: If the whole blood is used for the study, the whole blood samples need to be collected with a medium tube with 80 µL of ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid solution (EDTA, 7.5% w/w), and stored at −20 °C until extraction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":224}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DAY 2: BASE CLEANUP, LIPID REMOVAL, AND INTERNAL STANDARD SPIKING
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9kecl","text":"Label GC vials.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DAY 2: BASE CLEANUP, LIPID REMOVAL, AND INTERNAL STANDARD SPIKING
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a84pb","text":"Turn on the water bath with setting of 50 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DAY 2: BASE CLEANUP, LIPID REMOVAL, AND INTERNAL STANDARD SPIKING
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"binrn","text":"Remove the IS standards from the freezer and allow to warm to room temperature (~ 30 min).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DAY 2: BASE CLEANUP, LIPID REMOVAL, AND INTERNAL STANDARD SPIKING
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"j4po","text":"Make fresh KOH-95% EtOH solution and set it aside for the base cleanup step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vihs","text":"Let samples sit on the lab bench for 15 mins, centrifuge, and transfer the top layer to combine with tube-D (volume ~5 mL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":101,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jucf","text":"Add 2 mL of hexane using a repeat pipettor to tube-C and vortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":46,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fm3id","text":"Transfer the top layer to tube-D with a short pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6es64","text":"In a small beaker, mix hexane:DCM (1:1) with acidified silica gel (5:1), swirl, and add the entire suspension with a short pipette on top of the silica gel in each SPE cartridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eu3v4","text":"Add uncombusted tubes to the bottom of the SPE manifold to collect the waste eluent from the SPE cartridges.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ad7kc","text":"Add 2 mL of hexane:DCM (1:1) with a long pipette to rinse to the SPE cartridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8clgg","text":"Add 0.2 g of silica gel with a combusted small glass funnel to the SPE cartridges.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mkg2","text":"Add glass wool to the SPE cartridge and pack it down with the end of a glass pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fcukm","text":"Replace the top and place the clean SPE cartridges into each port.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62ind","text":"Mix the suspension with a short glass pipette tip to eliminate air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"j3bg","text":"Let the silica gel precipitate to the bottom before passing ~ 3 mL of hexane:DCM (1:1) into the bottom waste tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8c9r1","text":"\nNote: Always keep the solvent above the acidified silica gel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":61},{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"de531","text":"Add 3 mL of hexane to tube-E, then concentrate the sample under a gentle stream of nitrogen to ~50 µL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":22,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tp86","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vvud","text":"Note: Do not evaporate to dryness.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":34},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"92aqg","text":"Concentrate the samples in tube-E under a gentle stream of nitrogen to ~200 µL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3j0d2","text":"Turn off the manifold vacuum and remove tube-E from the SPE manifold.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":40,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"alhc6","text":"Transfer extracts from tube-E and the Reference standard with a long pipette to a combusted crimp-style GC vial with insert. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dekjl","text":"Vortex each tube-E.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eri3s","text":"\nDispose of all items as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dm4a5","text":"SPE Cartridges—Remove the cartridges from the SPE manifold and dispose of all content in the PCB waste container. Place the cartridges in the sink to be washed. Add the original waste tubes to the manifold, open the vacuum tube on the manifold, and turn on the vacuum. Clean the cartridge with acetone and then hexane. Turn off the vacuum and remove it. Let the top dry on its end, and once fully dry, place the manifold back on the shelf. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6ubi","text":"Evaporator – Place needles in the beaker to be combusted. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2um5m","text":"Tube-A, Tube-B, Tube-C, Tube-D, Tube-E, and other aqueous solutions – Aqueous hazardous waste ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":24,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tum3","text":"Organic solvents (waste tubes with hexane and 2-propanol) – Organic hazardous waste ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a55er","text":"All PCB-exposed disposable glassware, foil, GC vials, and gloves – Blue PCB hazardous waste container. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jesd","text":"Serological pipette – glass hazard container.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dbn29","text":"Store samples in solvent-proof -20°C freezer until instrument analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d1d1","text":"\nNote: Do not store samples in a regular -20°C freezer because solvent vapors will destroy the freezer over time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":112}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9vlj","text":"Cap all vials immediately with a crimp cap and crimper to seal the cap. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5on5p","text":"Store all samples, including the solvent blank, in a solvent-proof -20°C freezer until the data are published.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43qse","text":"\nNote: Do not store samples in a regular -20°C freezer because solvent vapors will destroy the freezer over time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":112}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8c8o","text":"Take the diazomethane vial out of freezer and place in an ice box in the fume hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2na54","text":"Add 1% KCl solution to the remaining tube A to a final volume of ~ 3 mL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pf0s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2ckf","text":"Note: Do not add 1% KCl solution to the tube for the Reference standard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":72},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":53,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bpkmc","text":"Add 5 drops of methanol to tube-C, except for the Reference standard, and vortex for 5 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Liquid-liquid extraction of 3,3'-dichlorobiphenyl (PCB11) and its hydroxylated metabolites from animal blood/serum
title_html: Liquid-liquid extraction of 3,3'-dichlorobiphenyl (PCB11) and its hydroxylated metabolites from animal blood/serum

versions.title: Liquid-liquid extraction of 3,3'-dichlorobiphenyl (PCB11) and its hydroxylated metabolites from animal tissues
versions.title_html: Liquid-liquid extraction of 3,3'-dichlorobiphenyl (PCB11) and its hydroxylated metabolites from animal tissues

versions.title: Liquid-liquid extraction of 3,3'-dichlorobiphenyl (PCB11) and its hydroxylated metabolites from animal blood/serum
versions.title_html: Liquid-liquid extraction of 3,3'-dichlorobiphenyl (PCB11) and its hydroxylated metabolites from animal blood/serum

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"6srbi","text":"The following section describes precautions for the safe handling of chemicals used in this protocol. Consult the Safety Data Sheet for additional information regarding all chemicals used in this protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqfqh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"api9u","text":"Acetone:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lmt6","text":"Work under hood. Do not inhale the substance/mixture. Avoid the generation of vapors/aerosols. Keep away from open flames, hot surfaces, and sources of ignition. Take precautionary measures against static discharge. Change contaminated clothing. Preventive skin protection is recommended. Wash hands after","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97pa0","text":"working with substance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chbms","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqk2s","text":"Diazomethane:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahodm","text":"Work under a well-ventilated fume hood with sash down. Routine housekeeping should be instituted to ensure that dusts do not accumulate on surfaces.
